ygData.subject: Re: JBoots, Rubi & Beyond
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Journeyman Boots are NoDrop because they have infinite charges.... in Beta, people would join a party and pass the boots around to everyone in the party.
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----

: From: Steve <cobb@...>
:
: Jboots being no drop I am not sure about. Seems to me


Journeyman Boots are NoDrop because they have infinite charges.... in Beta,
people would join a party and pass the boots around to everyone in the
party. Obviously in Final there would be chance of the jboots being stolen,
but this would still cause a major imbalance. So, they are NoDrop.

----- Original Message -----

: From: "Trevalien" <trevalien@...>
:
: How about gnoll fangs...these used to be dropable...if you didnt want em
you
: tosed em on the ground or auctioned them away for a few silver each. Now,
: even though you dont want them, some force poseses you to hold on to them.
: The only way to get rid of them is by crusing them and uterly destroying
: them. What was wrong with buying/trading gnoll fangs? It was a good way
for
: you to raise qeynos faction. All you get is a moonstone worth a few silver
: which you could turn in for a BB stout worth a silver or 2 more. Hardly
good
: money after lvl 5!

Fangs are NoDrop because they are one of the few ways to gain faction with a
couple of groups, and it defeats the purpose of the faction system if a rich
player can just buy them. You want faction, earn it.



If you have Rubi pieces, sell them or trade them now... it will never be as
valuable again as it will be in the next few days. Except of course for the
Rubicite Breastplate, this thing is the Black Lotus of EQ, hang on to that
for a long time, you'll probably be able to trade it for a car in about six
months :)
